alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 11:45AM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 AM EST, Around 3 inches of rain had fallen across greater Hendersonville resulting in lingering excessive runoff across the city. Out of bank conditions along parts of Mud and Bat Fork Creeks, and other select tributaries of the French Broad River, will continue. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana, Tuxedo, Crab Creek, Edneyville and Gerton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
